message: Should I bet on Angular again, burned before with the breaking changes, your thoughts?
story: Adel K. Khalil shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: All About Angular 2.0
caption: eisenbergeffect.bluespire.com
description: Have questions about the strategy for Angular 2.0? This is the place. In the following article I'll explain the major feature areas of Angular 2.0 along with the motivations behind any changes. Following each section, I'll provide you...

data.message: Check my comments on Alaa's share again.

Quoting the comment I talked about:

This is a very old post. A few things happened since then, including that the writer left Angular team and now is working on bringing his own almost dead competitor DurandalJS back to life.

http://eisenbergeffect.bluespire.com/leaving-angular/

I am no JS expert as I have said on this group, but from my experience with geeks and Technology, it looks like this guy should have been a leader in that team. I also do not trust companies as much as I trust geeks. I would be interested though to know if there are other alternatives that are more community driven and not part of some commercial company. It sounds like Ubuntu and Canonical here and that is why many people moved to Linux Mint and other distros.

So we had AngularJS 1.X, then other people created AngularDart (Both share the name only, nothing else!) & now we have 2 frameworks! AngularJS liked AngularDart, so instead of merging both projects, AngularJS 1.X team decided to recreate AngularDart from scratch!!!

That is what i am talking about i had an investment in Anguler 1.x and now its discontinued in favor of the new version, As much as i like the framework i couldn't use it again and risk having to port the whole codebase to the new version sometimes in the future and it's not like 5 or 10 years its few months.
It's not exactly like that, although pretty close. The Angular team is pretty much the same people working on AngularDart. It allowed them to experiment with several things they liked.

I recently did an in-depth presentation explaining how Angular 1.x, Angular 2.0 and AngularDart relate and differ. You can watch it here: http://gurustop.net/blog/2014/12/23/angularjs-1_3-1_x-angularjs-2_0-my-take
Thx Mohamed Meligy this is a huge time saver, will watch it thx again.
